intro: Papuacalia carstenszensis, commonly known as the Carstensens Island lily, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white flowers with purple streaks. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of the islands. It has strap-like leaves and produces showy inflorescences that bloom in the early morning. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
